      • create

        public IndexBuilderStarter create()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Starting point for the fluent graph index creation API.

        Use method chaining on the returned object, and call GraphElementIndexBuilder.build() on the last builder to create the new index.

        Adding a new graph index marks that particular index as dirty. When you are done adding all your secondary indices to the graph, call ChronoGraphIndexManager.reindexAll() in order to build them.

        Specified by:
        create in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Returns:
        The next builder in the fluent API, for method chaining. Never null.

      • getIndexedPropertiesOf

        public java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getIndexedPropertiesOf(java.lang.Class<? extends org.apache.tinkerpop.gremlin.structure.Element> clazz)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Returns the currently available secondary indices for the given graph element class.
        Specified by:
        getIndexedPropertiesOf in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Parameters:
        clazz - Either Vertex.class or Edge.class. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The currently available secondary indices for the given graph element class. May be empty, but never null.
        See Also:
        ChronoGraphIndexManager.getIndexedVertexProperties(), ChronoGraphIndexManager.getIndexedEdgePropertyNames(), ChronoGraphIndexManager.getIndexedEdgeProperties(), ChronoGraphIndexManager.getIndexedEdgePropertyNames()

      • reindexAll

        public void reindexAll()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Rebuilds all secondary graph indices from scratch.

        This operation is mandatory after adding/removing graph indices. Depending on the backend and size of the database, this operation may take considerable amounts of time and should be used with care.

        Specified by:
        reindexAll in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager

      • reindex

        public void reindex(ChronoGraphIndex index)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Recreates the index with the given name.
        Specified by:
        reindex in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Parameters:
        index - The index to recreate. Must not be null. Must refer to an existing index.

        This operation cannot be undone. Use with care.

        Specified by:

      • isReindexingRequired

        public boolean isReindexingRequired()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Checks if reindexing is required or not.

        Reindexing is required if at least one graph index is dirty.

        Specified by:
        isReindexingRequired in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Returns:
        true if at least one graph index requires rebuilding, otherwise false.

      • getDirtyIndices

        public java.util.Set<ChronoGraphIndex> getDirtyIndices()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Returns the set of secondary graph indices that are currently dirty, i.e. require re-indexing.
        Specified by:
        getDirtyIndices in interface ChronoGraphIndexManager
        Returns:
        The set of dirty secondary indices. May be empty, but never null.

      • executeOnGraph

        public <T> T executeOnGraph(ChronoGraph graph,
                            java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> job)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoGraphIndexManagerInternal
        Instances of ChronoGraphIndexManager internally hold a reference to their owning ChronoGraph. This method allows to temporarily exchange that reference with the given graph and execute the given job.
        Specified by:
        executeOnGraph in interface ChronoGraphIndexManagerInternal
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph to refer to during the execution of the given job. Must not be null.
        job - The job to execute on this manager while it is referring to the given graph. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The result of the job.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        job - The job to execute on this manager while it is referring to the given graph. Must not be null.
